name: 寫作指導（二）
restrict: ◎必須先修過【ENU0237  寫作指導（一）】
description: This two-semester course is to help students develop their ability to properly express themselves in written English. In the first semester, students are expected to acquire the fundamentals of English paragraph-writing, including structure (topic sentence, controlling idea, support and conclusion), outline, organization and coherence. In the second semester, students will extend their one-paragraph writing skills to three-paragraph short-essay writing. In addition, this course aims to equip students with analytic writing competence in response to different scenarios. In particular, course assignments will cover intensive writing practices in different modes, including description, narration, process, cause-effect, comparison-contrast, definition, and classification.
goals: This class is to help students improve their skills in writing English paragraphs/essays.

**Course description:**

The purpose of this course is to introduce students to the basic structure of a paragraph. Students will cultivate their skills in paragraph writingthrough the practice of the following genres: cause and effect, compare and contrast, definition, division and classification, and argumentation. 

**Textbook:**

Langan, J. (2010). _Paragraph skills_(2nd ed.). Chicago, Il: McGraw-Hill.

($383, 師大書苑：2F, #182-3, Hoping E. Rd.Taipei, 02-83695556)

**I.**    **Course Description:**

This purpose of this course is to help students develop their ability to express themselves in written English. By the end of the course it is expected that every student will be able to write a well-organized, and well-focused paragraph in English, using proper expressions and proper sentence structures. The course is chiefly conducted by means of actual writing, with the help of guided instruction and supplementary reading and reference materials.
